refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "add-to-plot" : Run Last "draw-data" : Run First "gradient-changed" : Run Last "gradient-colors-changed" : Run Last "update" : Run Last

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
A GtkPlotData object contains multiple dimensions of data for GtkPlots. Each dimension has a name, a label, a description and an array of typed values.
Each GtkPlot can display multiple GtkPlotData sets.

Predefined dimension names are: "x" for X values, "y" for Y values, "z" for Z values, "a" for Symbol size, "dx" for X error, "dy" for Y error, "dz" for Z error, "da" for amplitude values, "labels" for value labels

refsect2.title: GtkPlotData
refsect2.para: The GtkPlotData struct contains only private data. It should only be accessed through the functions described below.

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_new_iterator ()
gtk_plot_data_construct_iterator ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_plot_data_construct_iterator (GtkPlotData *data, GtkPlotIterator iterator, gint npoints, guint16 mask);

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_add_dimension ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_plot_data_add_dimension (GtkPlotData *data, const gchar *name, const gchar *label, const gchar *desc, GType value_type, gboolean required, gboolean independent);

listitem.simpara: dimension name to be searched for
(transfer none) the GtkPlotArray with the given name

listitem.simpara: the dimension name to be searched
(transfer none) the GtkPlotArray with the given name

gtk_plot_data_set_points ()

listitem.simpara: number of points = length of arrays

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_get_points ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_plot_data_get_points (GtkPlotData *dataset, gdouble **x, gdouble **y, gdouble **dx, gdouble **dy, gint *num_points);
refsect2.para: Retrieves pointers to internal plot data. Beware: The plot data belongs to the caller of #gtk_plot_data_set_points()

listitem.simpara: (transfer none) where to store result pointer
(transfer none) where to store result pointer
(transfer none) where to store result pointer
(transfer none) where to store result pointer
(transfer none) where to store number of points

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_get_point ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_plot_data_get_point (GtkPlotData *dataset, gint n, gdouble *x, gdouble *y, gdouble *z, gdouble *a, gdouble *dx, gdouble *dy, gdouble *dz, gdouble *da, gchar **label, gboolean *error);

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_set_x ()
refsect2.para: Set pointer to plot data (x-values). The plot data is not duplicated. It belongs to the caller of #gtk_plot_data_set_x().

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_set_y ()
refsect2.para: Set pointer to plot data (y-values). The plot data is not duplicated. It belongs to the caller of #gtk_plot_data_set_y().

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_set_z ()
refsect2.para: Set pointer to plot data (z-values). The plot data is not duplicated. It belongs to the caller of #gtk_plot_data_set_z().

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_set_a ()
refsect2.para: Set pointer to plot data (Symbol size). The plot data is not duplicated. It belongs to the caller of #gtk_plot_data_set_a().

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_set_dx ()
refsect2.para: Set pointer to plot data (x-error). The plot data is not duplicated. It belongs to the caller of #gtk_plot_data_set_dx().

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_set_dy ()
refsect2.para: Set pointer to plot data (y-error). The plot data is not duplicated. It belongs to the caller of #gtk_plot_data_set_dy().

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_set_dz ()
refsect2.para: Set pointer to plot data (z-error). The plot data is not duplicated. It belongs to the caller of #gtk_plot_data_set_dz().

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_set_da ()
refsect2.para: Set pointer to plot data (Amplitude). The plot data is not duplicated. It belongs to the caller of #gtk_plot_data_set_da().

refsect2.title: gtk_plot_data_get_x ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves a pointer to internal plot data. The plot data belongs to the caller of of #gtk_plot_data_set_x().

(transfer none) pointer to internal plot data

refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkPlotData *plotdata, GtkPlot *arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run Last

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
